forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. Low around 48, with temperatures rising to around 50 overnight. West wind around 7 mph.

weather_report:
A tranquil shroud blankets Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, where the sky wears a steady coat of gray as clouds drift languidly above. With temperatures hovering just above a cool 60 degrees, the air carries a gentle whisper of a breeze from the west, wrapping the city in a cloak of mildness that beckons one to stay snug. Visibility may be compromised, as vestiges of the marine layer cling stubbornly near the Golden Gate, obscuring views and morphing the landscape into something dreamily abstract. The atmosphere is layered with a hushed quiet, inviting introspection rather than hurried pursuits.

As twilight approaches, the clouds will nestle deeper into their embrace, but the temperature will rise ever so slightly, making evening strolls quite pleasant for those cloaked in warmer attire—perhaps a light sweater or a duster, accompanied by comfortable shoes to navigate the city’s uneven streets. This isn’t a day for grand plans; rather, it’s suited for cozy cafés with a steaming cup of tea or a leisurely read at home as the fog descends outside. If one chooses to venture out, a gentle walk along the waterfront to appreciate the city’s soft outlines against the encroaching dusk may be the perfect way to savor the serene beauty enveloping San Francisco tonight.
